column4: that said, I've never seen a report of wine being infected. I think because wine users don't surf from inside wine as a rule...
most of us don't consider the ability to pass on a virus as a good thing :-)
but that's all the servers running in unix/linux do every days by passing those nasty things to windows client, and got them infected, because they don't stop it.
got winlux?
winlux/winux?
googling it now...
gnome is a x windows server? can i use kde in ubuntu, and switch between them?
you can use either. And there are dozens more if you don't like those...
winlux appears to be a news site. Was there something specific you wanted me to see there?
no, i'm just thinking of combining linux, and windows into a new os.
good luck with that....
ProfOak: getting seriously off-topic guys....
ProfOak: take it to #ubuntu-offtopic please if you want to continue...
drop it, or move it. Or risk being bounced....
an operator can ban you. Very easily...
even if you change ip & username, if you come back talking about the same off-topic, we'll catch on. We're not *that* dumb...
of-course, uallnotdumpguys, lol, me too. :-D
the ban doesn't last for long. Just long enough to discourage bad behavior
I've never heard of it. More importantly. neither apparently has google. Got any context?
My friend said it was from Japan, and it's a hardware for computer,it hide the owner I.P..
I still don't see anything that fits in google. Could you have translated it wrong? At this point it's starting to look very off-topic
